subject: Re: [junit] Whether I must extends TestCase?
msgSnippet: ... You cannot. Java only allows single inheritance, and JUnit test case classes must extend TestCase, therefore they cannot also extend your class. What are
messageBody:
�ffffd2�fffffc�ffffce�ffffb0�ffffc3�fffffa wrote:

> I want to make a test case. But I want the test class
> extends my own superclass. How can I do that??

You cannot. Java only allows single inheritance, and JUnit test case
classes must extend TestCase, therefore they cannot also extend your class.

What are you trying to do that makes you want your test case class to
extend your own class? Perhaps we can find another solution.

(By the way, in NUnit, what you propose is possible, because there, test
case classes do not inherit from a framework class. If you were using C#
or VB.NET, then you would be able to do it.)

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
